perturbation.original_text: Contractor reserves the right to change rates with 30 days notice to Company.
perturbation.changed_text: Contractor reserves the right to change rates with 30 days notice to Company. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Contractor may increase rates immediately if market conditions warrant such an increase.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a conflict by stating that rates can be changed with 30 days' notice, but then adding that rates can be increased immediately under certain conditions. This creates ambiguity about when rate changes can occur and the required notice period.

perturbation.original_text: At any time that there is no uncompleted Statement of Work outstanding, either party may terminate this Agreement for any or no reason upon fifteen (15) days advance notice to the other.
perturbation.changed_text: At any time that there is no uncompleted Statement of Work outstanding, either party may terminate this Agreement for any or no reason upon fifteen (15) days advance notice to the other. However, Company may terminate this agreement at any time without notice if Contractor violates any local, state, or federal law.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a conflict regarding the termination clause. Originally, either party could terminate with 15 days' notice. The modified clause allows the Company to terminate immediately without notice under specific circumstances, creating ambiguity about termination requirements.

perturbation.original_text: In any suit arising from this agreement each party shall be responsible for its own attorneys fees. Company and Contractor hereby waive any claim to award of attorneys fees in such a suit.
perturbation.changed_text: In any suit arising from this agreement each party shall be responsible for its own attorneys fees. Company and Contractor hereby waive any claim to award of attorneys fees in such a suit. Notwithstanding the above, if Contractor is found to be in gross negligence, the court may award reasonable attorney fees to Company.
perturbation.explanation: The added sentence creates an inconsistency. The original text explicitly waives any claim to attorneys' fees for either party. However, the added exception allows the court to award attorney fees to the Company if Contractor is grossly negligent, contradicting the initial waiver and creating uncertainty about fee recovery in litigation.
